titleproper.value: Guide to Theodore Bonin Collection on Downtown Artists <num>MSS.486</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2017-09-05T13:21:49</date>

unittitle.value: Theodore Bonin Collection on Downtown Artists

extent.value: in 2 manuscript boxes, 1 flat box, and 2 oversize folders

abstract.value: This collection was assembled by gallery owner Theodore Bonin, containing 61 artworks and publications from over 20 artists including Tom Otterness, Lisa Bowman, Judy Rifka, Janine Antoni, and Luis Frangella, who were active in New York's downtown art scene during the 1980s and 1990s. Artwork mediums include hand colored and painted works on paper, wood sculpture, ceramic sculptures, prints, and assemblages.

p.value: Open to researchers. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival collections.
Identification of item, date; Theodore Bonin Collection on Downtown Artists; MSS 486; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.
Donated by Theodore Bonin in December, 2016; the accession number associated with this gift is 2017.031.

Theodore Bonin is an art collector and part owner of Alexander and Bonin, a New York art gallery established in 1995, whose primary purpose is to represent and support the work of emerging, mid-career, and established international contemporary artists.

This collection contains 61 artworks and publications, accumulated by Theodore Bonin over many years, from over 20 artists including Tom Otterness, Lisa Bowman, Judy Rifka, Janine Antoni, and Luis Frangella, who were active in New York's downtown art scene during the 1980s and 1990s. Artwork media represented in this collection include painted or drawn works on paper, wood sculpture, ceramic sculptures, prints, and assemblages, all produced during the 1980s and 1990s. This collection illustrates popular mediums and subject matter in artworks in this community of artists in New York.

subject.value: Artists and community -- New York (State) -- New York
